018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.quotas;
019
020import java.util.Arrays;
021import java.util.List;
022import org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration;
023import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Mutation;
024import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Result;
025import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcCall;
026import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer;
027import org.apache.yetus.audience.InterfaceAudience;
028import org.apache.yetus.audience.InterfaceStability;
029
030import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos;
031
032@InterfaceAudience.Private
033@InterfaceStability.Evolving
034public class DefaultOperationQuota implements OperationQuota {
035
036  // a single scan estimate can consume no more than this proportion of the limiter's limit
037  // this prevents a long-running scan from being estimated at, say, 100MB of IO against
038  // a <100MB/IO throttle (because this would never succeed)
039  private static final double MAX_SCAN_ESTIMATE_PROPORTIONAL_LIMIT_CONSUMPTION = 0.9;
040
041  protected final List<QuotaLimiter> limiters;
042  private final long writeCapacityUnit;
043  private final long readCapacityUnit;
044
045  // the available read/write quota size in bytes
046  protected long readAvailable = 0;
047  // estimated quota
048  protected long writeConsumed = 0;
049  protected long readConsumed = 0;
050  protected long writeCapacityUnitConsumed = 0;
051  protected long readCapacityUnitConsumed = 0;
052  // real consumed quota
053  private final long[] operationSize;
054  // difference between estimated quota and real consumed quota used in close method
055  // to adjust quota amount. Also used by ExceedOperationQuota which is a subclass
056  // of DefaultOperationQuota
057  protected long writeDiff = 0;
058  protected long readDiff = 0;
059  protected long writeCapacityUnitDiff = 0;
060  protected long readCapacityUnitDiff = 0;
061  private boolean useResultSizeBytes;
062  private long blockSizeBytes;
063  private long maxScanEstimate;
064
065  public DefaultOperationQuota(final Configuration conf, final int blockSizeBytes,
066    final QuotaLimiter... limiters) {
067    this(conf, Arrays.asList(limiters));
068    this.useResultSizeBytes =
069      conf.getBoolean(OperationQuota.USE_RESULT_SIZE_BYTES, USE_RESULT_SIZE_BYTES_DEFAULT);
070    this.blockSizeBytes = blockSizeBytes;
071    long readSizeLimit =
072      Arrays.stream(limiters).mapToLong(QuotaLimiter::getReadLimit).min().orElse(Long.MAX_VALUE);
073    maxScanEstimate = Math.round(MAX_SCAN_ESTIMATE_PROPORTIONAL_LIMIT_CONSUMPTION * readSizeLimit);
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * NOTE: The order matters. It should be something like [user, table, namespace, global]
078   */
079  public DefaultOperationQuota(final Configuration conf, final List<QuotaLimiter> limiters) {
080    this.writeCapacityUnit =
081      conf.getLong(QuotaUtil.WRITE_CAPACITY_UNIT_CONF_KEY, QuotaUtil.DEFAULT_WRITE_CAPACITY_UNIT);
082    this.readCapacityUnit =
083      conf.getLong(QuotaUtil.READ_CAPACITY_UNIT_CONF_KEY, QuotaUtil.DEFAULT_READ_CAPACITY_UNIT);
084    this.limiters = limiters;
085    int size = OperationType.values().length;
086    operationSize = new long[size];
087
088    for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
089      operationSize[i] = 0;
090    }
091  }
092
093  @Override
094  public void checkBatchQuota(int numWrites, int numReads) throws RpcThrottlingException {
095    updateEstimateConsumeBatchQuota(numWrites, numReads);
096    checkQuota(numWrites, numReads);
097  }
098
099  @Override
100  public void checkScanQuota(ClientProtos.ScanRequest scanRequest, long maxScannerResultSize,
101    long maxBlockBytesScanned, long prevBlockBytesScannedDifference) throws RpcThrottlingException {
102    updateEstimateConsumeScanQuota(scanRequest, maxScannerResultSize, maxBlockBytesScanned,
103      prevBlockBytesScannedDifference);
104    checkQuota(0, 1);
105  }
106
107  private void checkQuota(long numWrites, long numReads) throws RpcThrottlingException {
108    readAvailable = Long.MAX_VALUE;
109    for (final QuotaLimiter limiter : limiters) {
110      if (limiter.isBypass()) {
111        continue;
112      }
113
114      long maxRequestsToEstimate = limiter.getRequestNumLimit();
115      long maxReadsToEstimate = Math.min(maxRequestsToEstimate, limiter.getReadNumLimit());
116      long maxWritesToEstimate = Math.min(maxRequestsToEstimate, limiter.getWriteNumLimit());
117      long maxReadSizeToEstimate = Math.min(readConsumed, limiter.getReadLimit());
118      long maxWriteSizeToEstimate = Math.min(writeConsumed, limiter.getWriteLimit());
119
120      limiter.checkQuota(Math.min(maxWritesToEstimate, numWrites),
121        Math.min(maxWriteSizeToEstimate, writeConsumed), Math.min(maxReadsToEstimate, numReads),
122        Math.min(maxReadSizeToEstimate, readConsumed), writeCapacityUnitConsumed,
123        readCapacityUnitConsumed);
124      readAvailable = Math.min(readAvailable, limiter.getReadAvailable());
125    }
126
127    for (final QuotaLimiter limiter : limiters) {
128      limiter.grabQuota(numWrites, writeConsumed, numReads, readConsumed, writeCapacityUnitConsumed,
129        readCapacityUnitConsumed);
130    }
131  }
132
133  @Override
134  public void close() {
135    // Adjust the quota consumed for the specified operation
136    writeDiff = operationSize[OperationType.MUTATE.ordinal()] - writeConsumed;
137
138    long resultSize =
139      operationSize[OperationType.GET.ordinal()] + operationSize[OperationType.SCAN.ordinal()];
140    if (useResultSizeBytes) {
141      readDiff = resultSize - readConsumed;
142    } else {
143      long blockBytesScanned =
144        RpcServer.getCurrentCall().map(RpcCall::getBlockBytesScanned).orElse(0L);
145      readDiff = Math.max(blockBytesScanned, resultSize) - readConsumed;
146    }
147
148    writeCapacityUnitDiff =
149      calculateWriteCapacityUnitDiff(operationSize[OperationType.MUTATE.ordinal()], writeConsumed);
150    readCapacityUnitDiff = calculateReadCapacityUnitDiff(
151      operationSize[OperationType.GET.ordinal()] + operationSize[OperationType.SCAN.ordinal()],
152      readConsumed);
153
154    for (final QuotaLimiter limiter : limiters) {
155      if (writeDiff != 0) {
156        limiter.consumeWrite(writeDiff, writeCapacityUnitDiff);
157      }
158      if (readDiff != 0) {
159        limiter.consumeRead(readDiff, readCapacityUnitDiff);
160      }
161    }
162  }
163
164  @Override
165  public long getReadAvailable() {
166    return readAvailable;
167  }
168
169  @Override
170  public long getReadConsumed() {
171    return readConsumed;
172  }
173
174  @Override
175  public void addGetResult(final Result result) {
176    operationSize[OperationType.GET.ordinal()] += QuotaUtil.calculateResultSize(result);
177  }
178
179  @Override
180  public void addScanResult(final List<Result> results) {
181    operationSize[OperationType.SCAN.ordinal()] += QuotaUtil.calculateResultSize(results);
182  }
183
184  @Override
185  public void addMutation(final Mutation mutation) {
186    operationSize[OperationType.MUTATE.ordinal()] += QuotaUtil.calculateMutationSize(mutation);
187  }
188
189  /**
190   * Update estimate quota(read/write size/capacityUnits) which will be consumed
191   * @param numWrites the number of write requests
192   * @param numReads  the number of read requests
193   */
194  protected void updateEstimateConsumeBatchQuota(int numWrites, int numReads) {
195    writeConsumed = estimateConsume(OperationType.MUTATE, numWrites, 100);
196
197    if (useResultSizeBytes) {
198      readConsumed = estimateConsume(OperationType.GET, numReads, 100);
199    } else {
200      // assume 1 block required for reads. this is probably a low estimate, which is okay
201      readConsumed = numReads > 0 ? blockSizeBytes : 0;
202    }
203
204    writeCapacityUnitConsumed = calculateWriteCapacityUnit(writeConsumed);
205    readCapacityUnitConsumed = calculateReadCapacityUnit(readConsumed);
206  }
207
208  /**
209   * Update estimate quota(read/write size/capacityUnits) which will be consumed
210   * @param scanRequest                     the scan to be executed
211   * @param maxScannerResultSize            the maximum bytes to be returned by the scanner
212   * @param maxBlockBytesScanned            the maximum bytes scanned in a single RPC call by the
213   *                                        scanner
214   * @param prevBlockBytesScannedDifference the difference between BBS of the previous two next
215   *                                        calls
216   */
217  protected void updateEstimateConsumeScanQuota(ClientProtos.ScanRequest scanRequest,
218    long maxScannerResultSize, long maxBlockBytesScanned, long prevBlockBytesScannedDifference) {
219    if (useResultSizeBytes) {
220      readConsumed = estimateConsume(OperationType.SCAN, 1, 1000);
221    } else {
222      long estimate = getScanReadConsumeEstimate(blockSizeBytes, scanRequest.getNextCallSeq(),
223        maxScannerResultSize, maxBlockBytesScanned, prevBlockBytesScannedDifference);
224      readConsumed = Math.min(maxScanEstimate, estimate);
225    }
226
227    readCapacityUnitConsumed = calculateReadCapacityUnit(readConsumed);
228  }
229
230  protected static long getScanReadConsumeEstimate(long blockSizeBytes, long nextCallSeq,
231    long maxScannerResultSize, long maxBlockBytesScanned, long prevBlockBytesScannedDifference) {
232    /*
233     * Estimating scan workload is more complicated, and if we severely underestimate workloads then
234     * throttled clients will exhaust retries too quickly, and could saturate the RPC layer
235     */
236    if (nextCallSeq == 0) {
237      // start scanners with an optimistic 1 block IO estimate
238      // it is better to underestimate a large scan in the beginning
239      // than to overestimate, and block, a small scan
240      return blockSizeBytes;
241    }
242
243    boolean isWorkloadGrowing = prevBlockBytesScannedDifference > blockSizeBytes;
244    if (isWorkloadGrowing) {
245      // if nextCallSeq > 0 and the workload is growing then our estimate
246      // should consider that the workload may continue to increase
247      return Math.min(maxScannerResultSize, nextCallSeq * maxBlockBytesScanned);
248    } else {
249      // if nextCallSeq > 0 and the workload is shrinking or flat
250      // then our workload has likely plateaued. We can just rely on the existing
251      // maxBlockBytesScanned as our estimate in this case.
252      return maxBlockBytesScanned;
253    }
254  }
255
256  private long estimateConsume(final OperationType type, int numReqs, long avgSize) {
257    if (numReqs > 0) {
258      return avgSize * numReqs;
259    }
260    return 0;
261  }
262
263  private long calculateWriteCapacityUnit(final long size) {
264    return (long) Math.ceil(size * 1.0 / this.writeCapacityUnit);
265  }
266
267  private long calculateReadCapacityUnit(final long size) {
268    return (long) Math.ceil(size * 1.0 / this.readCapacityUnit);
269  }
270
271  private long calculateWriteCapacityUnitDiff(final long actualSize, final long estimateSize) {
272    return calculateWriteCapacityUnit(actualSize) - calculateWriteCapacityUnit(estimateSize);
273  }
274
275  private long calculateReadCapacityUnitDiff(final long actualSize, final long estimateSize) {
276    return calculateReadCapacityUnit(actualSize) - calculateReadCapacityUnit(estimateSize);
277  }
278}
